overview.description: A deeply structured, hands-on introduction to Python programming designed for absolute beginners. This course teaches Python from the ground up, progressing through fine-grained modules and lessons that drill down to specific skills, such as working with variables, data types, string manipulation, if/elif/else conditions, loops (for/while), lists, dictionaries, functions, and beginner project-building. Each lesson includes concepts, micro-exercises, hands-on labs, and knowledge checks to ensure practical understanding.
overview.target_audience: Complete beginners with no prior programming experience who want a structured, step-by-step path to mastering Python fundamentals.
prerequisites: Basic computer literacy (creating folders, opening applications)
Ability to install software such as Python and JupyterLab

modules.title: Getting Started with Python
modules.description: Introduction to Python programming, installation, and basic syntax.

lessons.title: Installing Python and JupyterLab
lessons.summary: Learn how to install Python and set up JupyterLab for coding.

hands_on_labs.title: Lab: Your First Python Script
hands_on_labs.goal: Write and run a simple Python script that prints 'Hello, World!'

micro_exercises.title: Verify Python Installation
micro_exercises.task: Open a terminal and type 'python --version' to check if Python is installed.

micro_exercises.title: Create a New Jupyter Notebook
micro_exercises.task: Launch JupyterLab and create a new notebook titled 'My First Notebook'.

knowledge_check.question: What command do you use to check Python version?
knowledge_check.answer: 'python --version' or 'python3 --version'

knowledge_check.question: Why is JupyterLab useful?
knowledge_check.answer: It provides an interactive environment for writing and testing Python code.

main_exercise.title: Main Exercise
main_exercise.task: Complete the main exercise for Installing Python and JupyterLab

lessons.title: Understanding Python Syntax
lessons.summary: Explore the basic syntax of Python, including indentation and comments.

hands_on_labs.title: Lab: Writing Your First Script
hands_on_labs.goal: Create a Python script that includes comments and proper indentation.

micro_exercises.title: Indentation Practice
micro_exercises.task: Write a simple script that uses indentation to define a function.

micro_exercises.title: Comment Your Code
micro_exercises.task: Add comments to your previous script explaining each part.

knowledge_check.question: What is the role of indentation in Python?
knowledge_check.answer: It defines the structure and flow of the code.

knowledge_check.question: How do you write a single-line comment in Python?
knowledge_check.answer: Use the '#' symbol before the comment text.

main_exercise.title: Main Exercise
main_exercise.task: Complete the main exercise for Understanding Python Syntax

lessons.title: Variables and Data Types
lessons.summary: Learn about variables, data types, and how to use them in Python.

hands_on_labs.title: Lab: Working with Variables
hands_on_labs.goal: Create a script that uses different data types and performs operations.

micro_exercises.title: Variable Assignment
micro_exercises.task: Create variables for your name, age, and height.

micro_exercises.title: Data Type Identification
micro_exercises.task: Identify the data type of each variable you created.

knowledge_check.question: What is a variable?
knowledge_check.answer: A variable is a named storage location for data.

knowledge_check.question: What data type would you use for a person's age?
knowledge_check.answer: An integer data type.

main_exercise.title: Main Exercise
main_exercise.task: Complete the main exercise for Variables and Data Types

modules.title: Control Flow in Python
modules.description: Learn how to control the flow of your Python programs using conditional statements and loops.

lessons.title: Conditional Statements: if/elif/else
lessons.summary: Explore how to use conditional statements to control program flow.

hands_on_labs.title: Lab: Building a Simple Decision Maker
hands_on_labs.goal: Create a program that makes decisions based on user input.

micro_exercises.title: Create an if Statement
micro_exercises.task: Write an if statement that checks if a number is positive.

micro_exercises.title: Implement elif and else
micro_exercises.task: Extend your if statement to include elif and else for negative and zero.

knowledge_check.question: What is the purpose of an if statement?
knowledge_check.answer: To execute code based on a condition.

knowledge_check.question: How do you write an elif statement?
knowledge_check.answer: Use 'elif' followed by a condition and a colon.

main_exercise.title: Main Exercise
main_exercise.task: Complete the main exercise for Conditional Statements: if/elif/else

lessons.title: Loops: for and while
lessons.summary: Learn how to use for and while loops to repeat actions in your code.

hands_on_labs.title: Lab: Creating a Countdown Timer
hands_on_labs.goal: Build a countdown timer using a while loop.

micro_exercises.title: Write a for Loop
micro_exercises.task: Create a for loop that prints numbers from 1 to 10.

micro_exercises.title: Implement a while Loop
micro_exercises.task: Write a while loop that counts down from 10 to 1.

knowledge_check.question: What is the purpose of a for loop?
knowledge_check.answer: To iterate over a sequence or range of values.

knowledge_check.question: How does a while loop work?
knowledge_check.answer: It continues to execute as long as a specified condition is true.

main_exercise.title: Main Exercise
main_exercise.task: Complete the main exercise for Loops: for and while

lessons.title: Loop Control Statements: break and continue
lessons.summary: Learn how to control loop execution with break and continue statements.

hands_on_labs.title: Lab: Building a Number Guessing Game
hands_on_labs.goal: Create a game that uses break and continue to control the flow.

micro_exercises.title: Use break in a Loop
micro_exercises.task: Write a loop that breaks when a specific condition is met.

micro_exercises.title: Use continue in a Loop
micro_exercises.task: Write a loop that skips even numbers and prints only odd numbers.

knowledge_check.question: What does the break statement do?
knowledge_check.answer: It exits the loop immediately.

knowledge_check.question: What is the purpose of the continue statement?
knowledge_check.answer: It skips the current iteration and continues with the next.

main_exercise.title: Main Exercise
main_exercise.task: Complete the main exercise for Loop Control Statements: break and continue

modules.title: Data Structures in Python
modules.description: Explore Python's built-in data structures including lists, dictionaries, and tuples.

lessons.title: Working with Lists
lessons.summary: Learn how to create and manipulate lists in Python.

hands_on_labs.title: Lab: Building a To-Do List Application
hands_on_labs.goal: Create a simple to-do list application using lists.

micro_exercises.title: Create a List
micro_exercises.task: Create a list of your favorite fruits.

micro_exercises.title: Modify the List
micro_exercises.task: Add a new fruit to your list and remove one.

knowledge_check.question: How do you access the first element of a list?
knowledge_check.answer: Use list_name[0] to access the first element.

knowledge_check.question: What method would you use to add an element to a list?
knowledge_check.answer: Use the append() method.

main_exercise.title: Main Exercise
main_exercise.task: Complete the main exercise for Working with Lists

lessons.title: Dictionaries: Key-Value Pairs
lessons.summary: Understand how to use dictionaries to store data in key-value pairs.

hands_on_labs.title: Lab: Building a Contact Book
hands_on_labs.goal: Create a contact book application using dictionaries.

micro_exercises.title: Create a Dictionary
micro_exercises.task: Create a dictionary to store information about your favorite book.

micro_exercises.title: Modify the Dictionary
micro_exercises.task: Add a new attribute to your book dictionary.

knowledge_check.question: How do you access a value in a dictionary?
knowledge_check.answer: Use dictionary_name[key] to access the value.

knowledge_check.question: What does the get() method do?
knowledge_check.answer: It retrieves the value for a specified key.

main_exercise.title: Main Exercise
main_exercise.task: Complete the main exercise for Dictionaries: Key-Value Pairs

lessons.title: Tuples and Sets
lessons.summary: Learn about tuples and sets, their properties, and when to use them.

hands_on_labs.title: Lab: Using Tuples and Sets
hands_on_labs.goal: Create a program that utilizes tuples and sets for data management.

micro_exercises.title: Create a Tuple
micro_exercises.task: Create a tuple to store coordinates (x, y).

micro_exercises.title: Create a Set
micro_exercises.task: Create a set of unique colors.

knowledge_check.question: What is a tuple?
knowledge_check.answer: A tuple is an immutable collection of items.

knowledge_check.question: What is the main property of a set?
knowledge_check.answer: A set contains only unique items.

main_exercise.title: Main Exercise
main_exercise.task: Complete the main exercise for Tuples and Sets

modules.title: Functions and Modules
modules.description: Learn how to define and use functions to create modular code.

lessons.title: Defining Functions
lessons.summary: Understand how to define and call functions in Python.

hands_on_labs.title: Lab: Creating a Simple Calculator
hands_on_labs.goal: Build a calculator that uses functions for operations.

micro_exercises.title: Define a Function
micro_exercises.task: Create a function that adds two numbers.

micro_exercises.title: Call Your Function
micro_exercises.task: Call your function with different arguments.

knowledge_check.question: What is a function?
knowledge_check.answer: A function is a block of code that performs a specific task.

knowledge_check.question: How do you call a function?
knowledge_check.answer: Use the function name followed by parentheses.

main_exercise.title: Main Exercise
main_exercise.task: Complete the main exercise for Defining Functions

lessons.title: Parameters and Return Values
lessons.summary: Learn how to use parameters and return values in functions.

hands_on_labs.title: Lab: Building a Temperature Converter
hands_on_labs.goal: Create a function that converts temperatures between Celsius and Fahrenheit.

micro_exercises.title: Define a Function with Parameters
micro_exercises.task: Create a function that calculates the area of a rectangle.

micro_exercises.title: Return a Value
micro_exercises.task: Modify your function to return the area.

knowledge_check.question: What is a parameter?
knowledge_check.answer: A parameter is a variable used in a function definition.

knowledge_check.question: How do you return a value from a function?
knowledge_check.answer: Use the return statement followed by the value.

main_exercise.title: Main Exercise
main_exercise.task: Complete the main exercise for Parameters and Return Values

lessons.title: Organizing Code into Modules
lessons.summary: Learn how to organize your code into modules for better structure.

hands_on_labs.title: Lab: Creating a Module for Your Calculator
hands_on_labs.goal: Organize your calculator functions into a separate module.

micro_exercises.title: Create a Simple Module
micro_exercises.task: Create a module that contains your area calculation function.

micro_exercises.title: Import Your Module
micro_exercises.task: Import your module into a new script and use the function.

knowledge_check.question: What is a module in Python?
knowledge_check.answer: A module is a file containing Python code that can be imported.

knowledge_check.question: How do you import a module?
knowledge_check.answer: Use the import statement followed by the module name.

main_exercise.title: Main Exercise
main_exercise.task: Complete the main exercise for Organizing Code into Modules

modules.title: Building Projects
modules.description: Apply your knowledge by building small projects using Python.

lessons.title: Project: To-Do List Application
lessons.summary: Build a simple to-do list application using Python.

hands_on_labs.title: Lab: Building the To-Do List
hands_on_labs.goal: Create a functional to-do list application.

micro_exercises.title: Design the UI
micro_exercises.task: Sketch out how your to-do list application will look.

micro_exercises.title: Implement Task Addition
micro_exercises.task: Write code to add tasks to your list.

knowledge_check.question: What is the purpose of a user interface?
knowledge_check.answer: To allow users to interact with the application.

knowledge_check.question: How do you store tasks in a list?
knowledge_check.answer: Use a list to append tasks as they are added.

main_exercise.title: Main Exercise
main_exercise.task: Complete the main exercise for Project: To-Do List Application

lessons.title: Project: Simple Calculator
lessons.summary: Create a simple calculator application using functions.

micro_exercises.title: Implement Addition Function
micro_exercises.task: Write a function that adds two numbers.

micro_exercises.title: Implement Subtraction Function
micro_exercises.task: Write a function that subtracts two numbers.

knowledge_check.question: What is the purpose of a calculator application?
knowledge_check.answer: To perform arithmetic operations on user input.

knowledge_check.question: How do you handle division by zero?
knowledge_check.answer: Check if the denominator is zero before performing the division.

main_exercise.title: Main Exercise
main_exercise.task: Complete the main exercise for Project: Simple Calculator

lessons.title: Capstone Project: Personal Portfolio Website
lessons.summary: Build a personal portfolio website to showcase your projects and skills.

hands_on_labs.title: Lab: Building Your Portfolio
hands_on_labs.goal: Create a personal portfolio website to showcase your work.

micro_exercises.title: Sketch Your Website Layout
micro_exercises.task: Draw a layout for your portfolio website.

micro_exercises.title: Write a Project Description
micro_exercises.task: Draft a description for one of your projects.

knowledge_check.question: Why is a portfolio important?
knowledge_check.answer: It showcases your skills and projects to potential employers.

knowledge_check.question: What should you include in your project descriptions?
knowledge_check.answer: Include the project goal, technologies used, and your role.

main_exercise.title: Main Exercise
main_exercise.task: Complete the main exercise for Capstone Project: Personal Portfolio Website

capstone.title: Capstone Project: Personal Portfolio Website
capstone.description: Build a personal portfolio website to showcase your projects and skills.
